name: Walk-Run Intervals
description: Beginner-friendly cardio that alternates walking and running. Perfect for building endurance gradually. Foundation of Couch to 5K programs.

exercises.name: Week 1: Walk-Run (1min run / 2min walk)
exercises.description: Entry-level intervals - building confidence and base fitness
exercises.instructions: 5min easy walk warmup. Then 8 rounds of: 1min easy jog, 2min walk. Finish with 3min cooldown walk. Total: 32min.

conditions.knee_moderate: Focus on soft surface, reduce to 6 rounds if needed

exercises.paceGuidance: Jog should be VERY easy - barely faster than walking. Focus on completing the time, not the speed.
exercises.progressionNote: Repeat this 2-3 times per week for 2 weeks before progressing.

exercises.name: Week 3: Walk-Run (2min run / 1.5min walk)
exercises.description: Building run intervals - increasing running time
exercises.instructions: 5min walk warmup. Then 6 rounds of: 2min easy jog, 1.5min walk. Finish with 3min walk cooldown. Total: 29min.

conditions.knee_moderate: Monitor pain during jog intervals, walk extra if needed

exercises.paceGuidance: Still very easy pace - you should be able to hold a conversation during the jog intervals.
exercises.progressionNote: When this feels comfortable, you're ready for longer intervals.

exercises.name: Week 5: Walk-Run (5min run / 2min walk)
exercises.instructions: 5min walk warmup. Then 4 rounds of: 5min easy jog, 2min walk. Finish with 3min walk cooldown. Total: 36min.

conditions.knee_moderate: If pain appears during 5min intervals, walk earlier

exercises.paceGuidance: Focus on completing the 5min intervals comfortably. Pace should still be conversational.
exercises.progressionNote: This is a big step - don't rush it. Repeat 2-3 times before progressing.

exercises.name: Week 7: Walk-Run (10min run / 2min walk)
exercises.description: Long running intervals - approaching continuous running
exercises.instructions: 5min walk warmup. Then 3 rounds of: 10min easy jog, 2min walk. Finish with 3min walk cooldown. Total: 44min.

conditions.any_moderate: 10min is a long interval - monitor any discomfort closely

exercises.paceGuidance: Pace yourself - the second and third 10min intervals should feel the same as the first. Don't start too fast.
exercises.progressionNote: Once this feels manageable, you're close to running continuously for 20min+

exercises.name: Week 9: 20-Minute Continuous Run
exercises.description: First continuous run - no walk breaks!
exercises.instructions: 5min walk warmup. Then 20min continuous easy jog - NO WALK BREAKS. Finish with 5min walk cooldown. Total: 30min.

modifications.easier: 15min continuous, or add one 30s walk break at 10min mark

conditions.any_moderate: This is a milestone workout - only attempt if previous weeks went well

exercises.paceGuidance: Start slow! Many people fail this by starting too fast. The goal is to complete 20min without stopping, not to run fast.
exercises.milestone: This is a HUGE achievement! Most people can't run 20min continuously. Celebrate this!

exercises.name: Walk-Run Recovery Session
exercises.description: For experienced runners recovering from injury or returning after break
exercises.instructions: 30min total: alternate 3min easy jog, 1min walk throughout. Focus on form and comfort, not speed.

conditions.returning_from_injury: Perfect protocol for testing fitness after time off

exercises.purpose: Walk breaks allow experienced runners to monitor how body responds without risking re-injury. Also useful after illness or long break.
